content: LOS ANGELES — A military pilot who ejected from a crippled fighter over a San Diego neighborhood "screamed in horror" when he saw the jet had crashed into a home, according to documents released Tuesday. Lt. Dan Neubauer described in a statement to investigators how he struggled to control the malfunctioning F/A-18D Hornet in the minutes before the Dec. 8 crash that killed four people on the ground and incinerated two homes. Neubauer's statement, cluttered with military jargon, nonetheless provides a dramatic look inside the cockpit of the ailing aircraft as he flew toward tragedy. "I knew I had to get out. I pulled the nose up a little bit and then reached down between my legs for the ejection handle," Neubauer wrote. "The canopy blew and then after what seemed like an eternity I was ejected," the statement said. Dangling below his parachute, he looked down to trace the jet's plunge. "It had gone right into a house. I screamed in horror when I realized what had just happened," Neubauer wrote. "http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,510415,00.html" Photos available at above link also. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

title: Pilot 'Screamed in Horror' When Jet Hit Home

content: Tragic, I am sure the pilot did all he could possibly do, hope he doesn't rip himself up in the years to come. Riding the plane down would only add one more death. My sympathy to all involved.

title: Pilot 'Screamed in Horror' When Jet Hit Home

I just hope it doesn't affect his job. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: The PIC in question CHOSE to return to his departure airfield instead of landing at the local Channel Island one he was near. Most of his flight WAS over open water... Somehow... I think that pilot is going to think about that for the rest of his life... regardless of the results of the two investigations... Safety and Colateral.
